pageContext.claim: “The Green New Deal would completely abolish the American oil, natural gas, coal and nuclear power industries, of which we are now the leader in the world, with the biggest now in the world because of moves that I've made, happened over the last two years by the way.”
pageContext.analysis: The Green New Deal is a nonbinding resolution that calls for, among other things, a full transition to clean, renewable and zero-emission energy sources over 10 years. By extension, any greenhouse-gas-emitting energy source would fall out of use. But nuclear energy is a zero-emission energy source. Some consider natural gas to be a "clean" energy source, since it emits half as much carbon dioxide as burning coal. Trump is wrong to claim that the United States became the largest oil and natural gas producer because of moves he made. The U.S. has been the top natural gas producer since 2009. The Energy Information Administration says the U.S. became the top oil producer recently, under Trump's watch, but not because of his moves.
